title: Sonata Arctica - Ecliptica - Revisited (15th Anniversary Editio
description:
Sonata Arctica



Sonata Arctica was formed in 1996 on the edge of the world, in the northern Finnish town of Kemi.

Originally formed as Tricky Beans, they released few demos and as they got the contract they had to change their name.
In 1999 the band recorded a new demo Ã¢â‚¬Å“FullMoonÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ in Tico Tico Studios located in their hometown, Kemi. At the time of recording the line-up consisted of: Tony (vocals/keys), Jani (guitars), Tommy (drums), and Janne (bass). This new demo was the first exploration for the band in heavy metal waters. The bandÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s trademark sound of fast, melodic and keyboard oriented heavy metal with clear, high vocals was born. As fate would have it, and with help from Ahti Kortelainen of Tico Tico Studios, the Ã¢â‚¬Å“FullMoonÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ demo found its way to the premier metal label of Finland, Spinefarm. At the same time Tricky Beans became Sonata Arctica.

Summer of 1999 brought us the first single from Sonata Arctica, Ã¢â‚¬Å“UnOpenedÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½. The title song was instantaneously included in the Metalliliitto 1999 compilation CD.
